info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued October 10 at 2:02AM EDT until October 10 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Warning, one to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways.
* WHERE...Coastal Georgetown County.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT this morning through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 8 AM this morning to 2 PM EDT this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...Low-lying roads near the beaches, the Intracoastal Waterway, and adjacent tidal creeks will observe moderate coastal flooding. Roadways and structures adjacent to ocean swashes may be impacted. Check with local officials for the latest information regarding coastal flood impacts and closures. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
